intro: Pulsatilla rubra var. serotina, commonly known as the late-flowering pasque flower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, early spring blooms of pink or purple petals. The plant has a short, upright stem with basal leaves that are deeply lobed and hairy. It thrives in well-drained, alkaline soils and is often found in alpine or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
